Reviews.Title: “Great stop-over hotel, comfortable, efficient and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Melvey
Reviews.Content: I have tried almost every airport hotel en route to various destinations. But I have come back to Marriott and plan to stay. Marriott just seems to be a cut above the others. Price wise, it is comparable, although not cheap, and depending on your room category, etc. may be more, but I am a strong beleive in getting what you pay for. In terms of service (nice, knowledgable staff, fast check-in, great services for park n fly guests), comfort (the best bed/pillows ANYWHERE), and convenience (covered parking in Canada is a must if you travel in winter), I have not found another hotel on the Toronto ariport strip that offers any of the above. Marriott is part of our vacation experience, including the night before and the night following the flight back home to Canada. I also like that one can buy some of their products..would love to purchase some bedding and pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport stopover”
Reviews.Author: DParnell71
Reviews.Content: We've tried various airport park and stay hotels, and the Marriott is now our usual. The staff are friendly, the rooms are comfortable and clean, the hotel is close to the airport, and parking is in their underground lot on site - no brushing snow or scraping ice when you get back from your winter vacation. The pricing is pretty good - its cheaper than Park and Fly Valet parking, and cheaper than a limo for us. Their shuttle runs about every 30 minutes on a set schedule, so you know what time to go out to the post to catch your ride. As with other Marriott's, no breakfast included, but at the times we leave for the airport, we would be too early anyway. Wifi is not included, but that's about the only downside.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay”
Reviews.Author: philf2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in February and were quite pleased with the room. One of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept on. We ate in the hotel's restaurant and while the food was very good, it was somewhat overpriced. The only thing that we didn't like was the hotel's parking lot. They charge a good price to park there and the lot is very poorly planned. If the upper level is full, you have to back out part way and then discover that there is a lower level that is not visible at night when entering the lot. They could have done much better here.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if you want near by restaurants.”
Reviews.Author: TrentP1
Reviews.Content: Just recently stayed at this location. First off, I want me cookie! I didn't get one. Besides that. The hotel is a standard hotel. Clean rooms, bathrooms, etc. Didn't use the fitness room, so I can comment on this. As for the bar in the hotel. Staff is top notch. I noticed that the bartender engaged in conversations to make us feel welcomed. The front staff is great. I am joking about the cookie, as my colleague got one but I didn't even though I am a gold member and he wasn't. The shuttle was good, but somehow the driver was confused and drove through terminal one an three twice. That frustrated me. But, after finding that a taxi is 30 bucks, the shuttle isn't bad. The location is great for walking distance restaurants like the keg, lone star, etc. that's why I like this better than the sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: echolaine
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott for 4 nights while working an event at the Toronto Congress Center. It was about a mile away from the Congress Center - $7 or $8 CA each way. The room was spacious and clean, check in and check out were efficient. The gift store had a lot of items for the tiny space - I appreciated the variety. Wake up calls were easy to automatically schedule, and the friendly front desk person offered to schedule one for me when I inquired about the shuttle bus. The only downside this trip was that the shuttle to the airport did not run on time and someone at the front desk told my colleague that a cab ride to the Congress Center would be $20 - $30 CA, causing undue stress. $15.95 CA per day (not per 24 hours, per day), is way too expensive for high speed internet, especially when Marriott's lower end brands offer it for free. That alone will keep me from coming back, even though the property is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sjhanlon
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at all of the Marriott branded properties at or near Toronto Pearson Airport. This is by far the best choice - bar none. Greeted as a Platinum Guest and told parking would be free (Love that about this hotel - That's a $18 savings a night). Also told I had been upgraded to a large suite. In 7 years as a Marriott Gold or Platinum member this is the first time I have ever gotten a suite upgrade. I'm lucky if I even get on the Concierge Level. Beds are excellent at this hotel. Ordered room service... arrived in 25 minutes and like every other time the service was excellent. Bill under the door in the morning, quick call to check-out and on my way to the airport. Highly recommend this property - worth the extra money over the Courtyard next door. Read my reviews on that one - ugh.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Friendly, Convenient”
Reviews.Author: WaterMonkey
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a couple of nights for business and enjoyed my time. Very friendly staff, comfortable room, conveniently close to the airport, best clam chowder I've ever had in the restaurant, great service in the restaurant, and even had the chef come out to deliver my birthday dessert. Only problem I had was connecting my laptop to the internet in my room. Couldn't figure out how to do it and two calls down to the front desk didn't solve it. But there was free wifi in the meeting area and the lobby so it wasn't a great inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Much nicer than I expected”
Reviews.Author: Shmees
Reviews.Content: I was pretty nervous, tagging along with my husband on his business trip and staying at a hotel near the airport.... I thought it would be ugly and gross. I was very pleasantly surprised to find a very nice and very clean hotel. We were upgraded to a corner room which had an entire wall of windows, lots of space, not quite a suite but very close.

Reviews.Title: “Just 5-10 minutes from Airport (Free Shuttle)”
Reviews.Author: Isaac_10
Reviews.Content: Is really good to stay here, and more if your flight have a early departure. Is just 5-10 minutes from airport and this hotel has free shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: couponCobourg
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel room for a real bargain $86.00 for a king room. the bed and room was wonderful. Large room with lovely toiletries. Just wish we were there a llittle longer to enjoy it. Flew in from Fort Myers on our way to Edmonton. Shuttle service was prompt and courteous. One of the staff saw my husband and I struggling with our luggage and she insisted on helping us to our room. Nice touch. We went into the bar to have natchos and a beer and watch the remainder of the Super Bowl. The nachos was tasty and very large, we shared it. A great stay and I wourld recommend it once again.

Reviews.Title: “Average airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Snowflakesnsun
Reviews.Content: A little below average for Marriott brand. Comfortable bed,large room,toiletry what you would expect in a courtyard Marriott. Room service not so good though quite prompt and friendly

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel, all of the amentities”
Reviews.Author: ForeverMexico
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent. Very convenient location and the rooms were clean, bright, spacious and had modern decor. The hotel bar was a great environment and the in house store had lots of supplies that you may need. Staff were very helpful. Considering that the hotel was on a flight path it was extremely quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Solid airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: MPLSKevin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while on a business trip to Toronto. The hotel is a three minute drive to the airport, making it very convenient. As you'd expect, the area around the hotel is somewhat industrial, with few eating/entertainment options. The hotel room itself was efficient, with a fairly comfortable bed. The lighting in the room was a little dim, so I wound up turning on every lamp when I was in the room so that it didn't feel like a cave. The bathroom was tiny, but manageable. There is a great gym in the hotel with plenty of new equipment and extended hours, and a small but good looking pool. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. I would stay here again if I needed an airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for the airport”
Reviews.Author: MinusThirty
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms - large and comfortable. Good breakfast and fast internet. Pretty good choice for staying out at the airport. Getting back here from the hockey at the ACC midweek was also not bad - about 30 minutes. Would stay here again - my only beef would be no minibar in the room - unless it was hidden!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Johngil
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here. Rooms were big and clean. Bar and restaurants were excellent. Besides $10 for a beer, but you are in TO. Had a convention there and was treated really good by all. Food was exceptional during day too, even though there was 5 or 6 hundred people.

Reviews.Title: “Great value when overnighting at Toronto Pearson.”
Reviews.Author: weyburneagle
Reviews.Content: We found the room clean, the bed very comfortable. The rate was excellentgiben the quality of the bed and cleanlinesss. The on downfall was the quality of the food in the lounge. The pizza was barely above something you'd find at the supermarket. The wrap far too salty. The accompanying fries were under cooked and lower quality frozen.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the airport with outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: dreaming*of*a*beach
Reviews.Content: This hotel is literally across the highway from the airport. I needed a car service and driver and the front desk were extremely helpful in getting such a service arranged. I'll definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for hockey teams!”
Reviews.Author: MrsB413
Reviews.Content: My son's hockey team recently stayed at this hotel during a hockey tournament. I booked the rooms on behalf of the team. Everyone was so efficient and friendly from the sales staff all the way through to the front desk. We've stayed in other hotels in the area, but this is the one I would return to!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay over Christmas while visiting family!”
Reviews.Author: MrsSusieQ7
Reviews.Content: We had a King room - nothing fancy but spotless and excellent attentive service at every turn. Fantastic gym (well equipped - better than average) as well as pool, sauna and whirlpool. Restaurant great for breakfast. Only hassle was the way we had to get in and out of the self parking - the room key card was finicky (other guests had same problem) Bed was ok - pillows excellent but mattress could have been better:-)

Reviews.Title: “My first choice near the Toronto Airport”
Reviews.Author: John H
Reviews.Content: My biggest disappoint on my last business in the area was that this hotel had no vacancies. I have been here on a number of occasions and enjoy this property very much. The guest rooms are spacious, quiet and clean. I could barely hear the airport traffic, and even then is was well muted. The meeting spaces are excellent with a variety to choose from: ballroom (1,2,3) down to a small boardroom. The food is outstanding and my guests made specific mention of this in their feedback. And all staff really seem to care about each guest and the event as a whole. Full marks goes to them and the management for making me and my guests feel welcome and appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Large, Clean and Close to the Airport”
Reviews.Author: Travelbuglove83
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at the Toronto Airport Marriott while on route to Panama. First off, the rooms are huge. Two double beds, a full couch and there was still plenty of room to move about. The closet was also very large. Beds were very comfortable and we were greeted with a card and a snack ( Marriott gold member). The bathroom was normal, nothing to rave about. Though I do need to point out that recently, all the Marriottâ€™s Iâ€™ve been going to have stopped giving Bathwash and only provide bath soap. I donâ€™t like this one big and I hope Marriott stops this soon. I ordered room service and it was very prompt. A big plus since I it was 9 pm when I arrived and needed to be ready to leave again for a 6am flight. There is an airport shuttle that comes and goes every 20 minutes or so. Its about a 10-15 minute ride to the airport. I feel the need to point out that although the website doesnâ€™t state this, there is a Toronto Courtyard right behind the Marriott and the shuttle also stops there. I didnâ€™t go inside but it looked nice from what I can see. All in all, a pleasant stay though I think I need to point out that the rooms are a little costly. If I knew the Courtyard had a shuttle I would have definetly gone there instead.

Reviews.Title: “Functional hotel close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: ivanrmcc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights on a busines trip it is a mid range hotel typical of the sort you find near airports. Staff are OK but not overly friendly (and on one occassion down right rude). Room was spacious and the bathroom was was clean and large as well. Only downside was that the A/C in the room was quite loud when it kicked in during the night, waking me up every time. Good place to stay if you have a stop-over in toronto airport as it is only a few minutes from teh terminal but I wouldn't recommend it for anything else.

Reviews.Title: “It's an airport hotel, near an airport. Great catering!”
Reviews.Author: MHKtraveller
Reviews.Content: My last review of an airport hotel was of a stellar property near Chicago O'Hare. That was unique among the typical offerings. These locations serve their purpose to business travellers with airport meetings, leisure travellers with early departures, late arrivals, and everyone with cancelled flights. This Marriott is no different. Convenient, with frequent shuttle to terminals. Hotel and rooms are older but kept in reasonable condition. Rooms are smallish but well furnished. Bathtub and fixtures very dated. All in all a very average property with nothing specifically wrong but nothing really standing out. I will say this, if you have a meeting catered by this hotel, the food is superb with plenty of it. Desserts are grand and plentiful. Not sure what it costs since I didn't organize it but can say this hotel does a great job!

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel for airport travelers”
Reviews.Author: dssrriri
Reviews.Content: Overall not bad. Small exercise room, but little competition for machines. Large room 604, oversized king. Rooms are basic and outdated, so is the lobby. For price, and proximity to airport, decent price. Tried lunch at the dining room, which was reasonable quality, but limited menu.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, but why pay the extra?”
Reviews.Author: AmberK
Reviews.Content: This airport hotel is clearly designed for business travelers on an expense account. Why else would you pay about $30/night for almost the same room, plus $18/night parking, and $17 for internet rather than staying two blocks further down the road at the Marriott Residence? You get a free breakfast and a living room/kitchenette at the Residence inn, too. The hotel is nice enough, but nothing overly special. The only thing it has which the Residence inn doesn't is a bar and restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent property makes for a restful airport stay”
Reviews.Author: Mike W
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight during a short overnight stay prior to our flight. Front desk staff was extremely friendly. I am Gold with Marriott Rewards - but just barely as I tend to be a Hilton guy. If all of the Marriotts were like this place, I would change my allegiance in a New York second. My colleague is silver at Marriott and because we were traveling together they gave him free internet access as well. I was upgraded to a club level room with the associated benefits (lounge access, continental breakfast, etc.) The room is absolutely spotless and the bed probably the most comfortable I've slept in for many years. The hotel was comfortable, quiet, clean, and the service was spot-on. What more could I ask for? Convenient shuttle was offered on-demand to Landmark Aviation which saved me from needing to rent a car, pay for parking, etc. I was impressed and, should the need arise to return to Toronto, i'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, could be better”
Reviews.Author: missy720
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, and clean, the staff were nice, though did not go out of their way. Big downside is the terrible parking - its very expensive, and difficult to navigate. No free wireless was a downer, and the lack of a mini-fridge - i expect a fridge in a 4 star. There was a games room, but all the games were down, bit of a bummer. On the upside, the pool and gym were good, the pool was large, but a good depth for the kids and i to all have a good time. the atmosphere of the pool area was great.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid in an East Wind...”
Reviews.Author: Rvan58
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight recently because all the downtown hotels were booked due to TIFF. It is clear that this is an "Airport Hotel"; rrom the ambiguous staff to the dated dÃ©cor. I assume that the vast majority of their visitors spend a single night. There are limited amenities included with the room and any that you purchase are at significant rates. Parking a car adds and additional $18.00 per night to your bill, and while I understand this is cheap compared to landlocked downtown locations it appears to be nothing more than a money grab out here. The facility is clean and appears well kept but the furniture and fixtures are worn around the edges and starting to show their age. A quick walk through the dining room was enough to convince us to hit the road in search of a reputable local establishment. Oh, and I should remind you that this is an Airport hotel. Itâ€™s situated directly beneath the flight path for runway 24 at Pearson International where flights are allowed to take-off until almost 1:00 AM.

Reviews.Title: “A bit overpriced”
Reviews.Author: law20
Reviews.Content: Likes: -Marriott's rewards programs upgraded me to a King suite, which I was sad I only had one night to enjoy -As other Marriotts, this was clean and had a nice array of ammenties. Dislikes: - no wireless - internet is $15 (with a business hotel such as this and at this price level, I would expect complimentary internet, or at least in room wifi)

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and put on a meeting.”
Reviews.Author: hatlad
Reviews.Content: The only negative would be breakfast at the hotel restaurant West by East. The wait staff seemed far more attentive to chores than taking care of customers. A nearby table had to wave their arms and loudly say, "Hello! Excuse me." Several times to capture the attention of 2 waitresses chatting away at the wait station maybe 6 ft away. My waitress never did ask if I wished a drink refill. I set both empty glasses out at table edge by the aisle to get her attention they needed topping off. No response as she came by several times resetting nearby tables after diners had left. I finally flagged her down on her way by with a handful of freshly napkin-wrapped silverware to ask her for refills. She said yes but shot me a look that indicated she thought doing so was granting me the world's biggest favor. This is not appropriate behavior anywhere, let alone in an upscale hotel as this one. And for $16, they don't run the risk of overfeeding you on the Eggs Bendict. Up the portion size or lower the price. Guest room: Very comfortable, mostly quiet (hotel repairs going on around during business hours which were audible), slept very soundly. In-room internet not free. Thought the $16/day was a little pricey. Meeting facility: Very nice and effective meeting facility Brian and the banquet staff quite attentive to seminar needs and prepared very wonderful food for the event.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, expensive parking”
Reviews.Author: SludgeD
Reviews.Content: My son and I were traveling to Toronto for a little sight-seeing. I booked this hotel at a great rate through priceline. Being outside the city and an airport hotel, i didn't expect a pay for parking lot. When we pulled in the lot had a confusing bunch of gates and signs, so I went to the desk and checked in with the car in the driveway. Check in was smooth and the lobby was nice. They asked if I had a car to park and informed me it was $19 a day for parking! Wow, that is a pretty steep rate for valet parking in the city at most of the hotels I stay at, let alone self park in a fairly empty garage by the airport. Other than that, the stay was fine. We didn't spend much time at the hotel as we ran into the city for dinner and then got up early and left to continue our sight-seeing trip. The room was nicely decorated and comfortable. TVs and cable were all fine, and the bathroom was clean and functional. At the price I paid for the room, it was a good bargain, but I'd hate to pay the rack rate and get hit for parking, too.

Reviews.Title: “I hate to write a non-positive review, but I hate staying at barely passable, incorrectly rated hotels even more!”
Reviews.Author: snowBoardBunny
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks and feels like it has crawled out of the seventies on both the inside and out. Upon arriving, we parked our car first in the very user-unfriendly garage. The signage was pitiful - with no signage indicating dead ends ahead and no arrows telling you that you should go left to park when you first enter the gates. We parked on the first level near a sign where it indicating that you could get to the lobby. Check-in was smooth, easy. The front desk person was knowledgeable and courteous enough. The front lobby does have a flat screen tv showing all the departure stastii from Pearson airport nearby, which is the best thing about it. There was also the fruit dipped water jugs for guests that was a nice touch. But other than that, it really was an unremarkable entranceway. Our room was a decent size, but it seems that they are currently undergoing renovations. There was a plastic covering on the entire length of the hallway carpet to our room and beyond. This didn't seem so bad, until we were in our own room and could hear the crack, snapple, pop of all pedestrians in the hallway at all hours of the night and early morning. Honestly, it sounded like there were a bunch of kids popping bubble wrap out there! The biggest gripe about this so-called four star hotel, was that there was no in-room safe. Really Marriott? If I wanted to stay in a hotel room and keep all my valuables lying about for intruders or (and this has never happened to me -knock on wood) the cleaning staff to steal, then I would have chosen a hostel. And plastic soap dish and amenity stand? Really? Plastic? And you had to find the ugliest shade of poop-on-me-brown for these unhigh-class bathroom decorations? The door peephole is too high. Anyone under 5'4" tall or about 160 cm will not be able to verify their knocker's identity before opening their door. So if you plan to stay here, bring your own stool for the sake of the peephole, or just don't ever answer the door or order room service. The other big PEEVE is that damn shower head!!! That has to be the weakest pressure ever on any hotel shower head that I have used. I seriously had to sit under it for longer than 10 minutes to get all the shampoo and conditioning agent out of my hair. It is impossible to take a quick shower in there. At the end of the day, I got the room on a good web special price, so for the price it was just barely satisfactory. But if I had to pay the rack rate for this hotel, expecting four star quality, I would have been furious. Next time, I'll try one of the newer three star properties in the area that offer an in-room safe, free parking, and wifi. Oh BTW, no wifi access in the room, not even a paid option, just a wired paid option. Only free wifi is in the lobby - and it won't let you go to a competitor's website. Now I want to further deduct another star....

Reviews.Title: “Confortable bed and nice room”
Reviews.Author: OnlyMe48
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights for a business meetings.The beds were confortable and the place was nice and cleaned. Didn't like the food but everybody has different taste! : )

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel & Room, bad service”
Reviews.Author: packzz
Reviews.Content: We were heading to Toronto for one night to pickup some furniture and decided we wanted to stay the night due to all the driving. We jumped on priceline.com and found a room at this hotel for a very fair price. Upon arriving at the hotel we were very impressed with the look and feel, the lobby was beautiful and the front desk looked great. When arriving at the check-inn counter, admittably I was wearing shorts and a tshirt and didn't look like I belonged in a 4 star hotel. (clothing asside, I'm a business professional). The girl at the front desk was very dismissive and simply gave me my room key without telling us what type of room we were in, what floor we were on, checkout time, parking or anything. We had to ask where the elevators were, and we were still given a 'just over there', (they are down the hall around the corner actually). Once we found the elevators finding the room was very painless, although I was quite upset with being treated like I didn't belong, if the hotel didn't want the rooms to be discounted, they shouldn't be listing them on priceline. The room was absolutely stunning and worth every dollar, it was very clean and the furniture and TV was all modernized. Our room even came with VGA and hdmi hookups so you can hook your laptop up to your TV. They even simplied the cable in the room for free! We visited the basement to checkout the pool as well, didn't get a chance to use it, however it looked amazing and so did the jaccuzi. My dissatisfaction with this hotel is purely based on the customer service. Even when checking out, I requested the site to leave feedback for the hotel, and was given a card which I was told contained an email but had nothing but an address and phone number on it. She then asked "did you have any problems with your stay?" which I replied a yes to, and then she thanked me for staying at the Marriot. Bottom line, great hotel, beautiful rooms, absolutely the worst customer service I've ever encountered.

Reviews.Title: “All perfect”
Reviews.Author: ShalomSteph
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel very much. Our room was very clean, we each had a piece of chocolate :) on our pillows, a fireplace showing on the TV screen was a very warm welcome. The staff were all friendly and breakfast was rich and plenty. Our view was great. Would be back.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel nice but a few minor details you should know...”
Reviews.Author: ilovemanu_1999
Reviews.Content: Let me first say the hotel is nice. The room was comfortable and clean. The fitness center and pool were adequate. My wife used the fitness center while the kids and I enjoyed the pool for four nights. The hotel staff (from front desk to maid service) was very pleasant. Our first night, the front desk person offered my sick kid some soup. We politely declined, but that was very thoughtful of them. My kid got better on the 2nd night. With that said, a few things you should know about the hotel and the surrounding area. 1. No free WI-FI in room (this should be standard in all hotels nowaday). Even Red Roof Inn has free WI-FI in the room. Free WI-FI is available in the lobby. Grab a cold orange flavored water next to the front desk while you're there. 2. Hotel parking (outdoor or underground) is $18 per night. Steep. I think one of the hotels down the street is only $15. So for four nights, it's like paying another night at the hotel. 3. There are Hooters, sports bars/restaurants, and Strip clubs down the street. The nearest drug store is about 3 miles away. 4. The name of the hotel gives you an idea. It's next to the airport. So you will occassionally hear the midnight flight taking off. 5. The pool and fitness entrance is a little confusing on the initial visit. The entrance is not as obvious as you think. I watched myself and others have done the same thing. Listen to the click sound on your left. Don't grab the door in front of you. That's an exit. For the value I thought it was about right. I didn't pay the rack rate so you'll be the judge.

Reviews.Title: “Began poorly but ended well”
Reviews.Author: DougGC
Reviews.Content: I arrived late when the rain was pouring to find the parking entrance impassible. The ticket dispenser was jammed. When I reported this at the front desk, I found the desk clerk apologetic but not really listening. At the end of the brief check-in, I was handed a key card with instructions on how to use it to gain entrance to parking. When I repeated that no one could gain entrance to parking, the clerk finally picked up the phone and called engineering. Two or three cars waited along with me, and the problem was fixed within minutes. Things picked up after that. The room was of average size but had a comfortable king-sized bed. All the staff were pleasant. I stayed just the one night on my way elsewhere, but would happily return another time.

Reviews.Title: “A nice choice for the airport area BUT parking is $18 a day!”
Reviews.Author: VACanuck
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this property before, and were not disappointed on this stay. My only reservation is that the hotel only offers two doubles as opposed to two queens when more than two adults are staying together. We're not used to sleeping in such a small bed, but it was comfortable. The room is well equipped; nicely furnished and has an ample bathroom. The main areas of the hotel are well appointed as well. Staff are very effecient and friendly. The pool and fitness are are very nice. The hot tub was a bit TOO hot, and I pointed this out to a maintenance man who passed by. He immediately took exception to my comment even though he hadn't even confirmed the temperature of the tub. Other guests were there and all agreed the tub was extremely hot. It might have been comforting to know that he took our concerns seriously and checked the actual temperature of the tub instead of assuming it was exactly 104f as he said it was. I have been in hot tubs, and this tub was WAY hotter than 104f! Anyway, it was clean and the fitness room was very well appointed. No complaints there. I'm not sure if the pool was heated or not, but it was 35c that day, and it felt wonderful. Other guests said it was too cool. I enjoyed the cool water after being in that blistering heat outside. The hotel offers a shuttle to and from the airport, which is handy if you are flying in or out. The dining room is nice; prices are typical of a hotel; $15 for breakfast. VERY few other options in the area, but Casey's in the Travel Lodge across the street is opened for breakfast at about $10 instead of $15. Not much savings. No other options anywhere close by, so if you are a breakfast eater, prepare to pay over $20 for a meal with juice and/or coffee. Parking: They actually charge $18 a day for parking at this property, which is kind of ridiculous. Park and Fly is right across the street, so perhaps they're trying to dissuade non-guests from parking? It's a kick in the pants after paying for the room.... All in all, a nice stay. Would have preferred queen beds and a lower or non-existent parking rate, but what can you do?

Reviews.Title: “Good for 1 night stay”
Reviews.Author: LifePortfolio
Reviews.Content: Easily connected to Toronto via 192 Rocket and subway. Chose this hotel because I had an early morning international flight. I recommend it for all those who need it for this reason. There aren't many options for dining in the area. Staff was nice. Real close to the airport and has a complimentary shuttle Hotel room was nice and I didn't hear outside noise from the planes or anything else for that matter.

Reviews.Title: “Went out of their way to help - thank you!”
Reviews.Author: Carole154913
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, excellent location and superb service. I left behind my blackberry after a business meeting. The hotel staff found it, immediately called my office and sent it back to Calgary express delivery. By the time I got home I had three phone messages assuring me my blackberry was found and on its way. Thanks for going above and beyond expectations!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for travel at Pearson Airport”
Reviews.Author: UnicornUDIC
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice in May 2011, night before we flew to London and the night of our return. For the first night we paid slightly more to take advantage of the free parking for up to 15 nights. Note this is not always available. Rooms are spacious and extremely comfortable. The staff are quick, efficient and friendly. The restaurant is very good., as is room service. The jacuzzi was a little cool but the jets are powerful enough to knock your freckles off which is lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunately, if you don't want to sleep this is the place for you.”
Reviews.Author: TravellingSkaters
Reviews.Content: We were kept awake until past 4:30 in the morning by what the hotel claimed were a hockey tournament. We did complain both in person at the desk and by phone. They did send security which was useful for all of 5 minutes until it began again. We got a free movie for our trouble. We were there for Canadian Championships in short track speed skating, for which our child had been training for the entire season. We decided to stay overnight even though we live within an hour away because we wanted to get a good night's sleep without all the driving. It was a COMPLETE waste of our time and money. They should be ashamed as the host hotel for our competition and banquet. Absolutely disgusted.

Reviews.Title: “Nice bed, small room, friendly staff, dirtiest hallway carpet I've ever seen.”
Reviews.Author: NelsonCanadaTodd
Reviews.Content: Nice bed, small room, friendly staff, dirtiest hallway carpet I've ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good.”
Reviews.Author: travelbugcheri
Reviews.Content: Booked this room through Priceline at an amazing deal. The Good: ~Staff was great ~Quick check in ~Comfy beds and good linens ~Spotless ~Good quality shampoo, conditioner, lotion and soap. ~Great selection of movies (although pricey) The Bad: ~Parking was expensive $18.00 ~Internet only free in the lobby ~Small bathroom and only two towels ~Rooms weren't soundproof, could hear hall conversations and noises from other rooms Would I stay here again? If booked through Priceline, yes. But I don't agree with the 4 star rating. Needs upgrading and also needs to address the noise issues.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service!”
Reviews.Author: SugrCubes
Reviews.Content: I booked through their call center and due to down/feather allergies requested a feather free room. When I arrived at 6pm the front desk clerk discovered that the guest from the previous night had not vacated the room nor had they informed the desk. The clerk quickly resolved the matter, found another feather free room for me and upgraded me to the CLub Level! The rooms were well appointed, bright, and very clean. Staff was friendly and went that extra mile to ensure your satisfaction. Pool and Fitness room were among the best. All in all I would stay again and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: frankzappa-rip
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel and I will definitely stay there again. The rooms were very clean and the service was great. I was with a hockey team and booked for two nights. After the first night I learned that my sister passed away. I checked out at 6 p.m. fully expecting to pay for the second night but when I explained why I was leaving early they charged me only for the one night. They were genuinely sympathic to my circumstances and there were no questions asked. They treated me like a person and those are the places that I like to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Overnite stay in Toronto before hitting the sun in Jamaica”
Reviews.Author: smokey483
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Toronto after midnite as the flight was delayed in Regina . Picked up are luggage and gave the Marriott a call for the shuttle and he was their in a few minutes. Check in went smooth and we were satisfied with the room and the decor and bed was comfortable. The restaurant was closing so we had to just pickup some premade sandwiches that were a little pricey but they were okay. Got a wakeup call in the morning and took the shuttle back to the airport. Shuttle drivers were very good as they grabbed the luggage right away for you and put in on the bus. Overall i would stay here again for the price that i paid.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Marriott”
Reviews.Author: No_junkmail
Reviews.Content: A nice, standard Marriott with a kid friendly indoor pool.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: Geordie28
Reviews.Content: Travelled and stayed for 2 nights Typical marriot, not pretty outside, the rooms and breakfasts however more than made up for this. Huge bed and incredibly comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Great if you get a discounted rate!”
Reviews.Author: Luuvchis
Reviews.Content: The airport to hotel shuttle was very quick and the driver was helpful with my bag. The room was well appointed, and the bed and bedding very comfortable. This stay was for just one night before an early Toronto airport departure. My only complaint would be the lack of affordable food at the hotel. Some items available from room service included; soup for 9.00, seafood chowder for 11.00, a hamburger for 17.00. Im sorry but I will not pay those prices for hotel food! There was a small sandwich and salad bar in the lobby, where I did buy a ham, lettuce and cheese sandwich for 6.50. It was heavy on the bread, and light on the ham and cheese, with lettuce that was brown on the edges. I could hardly get that sandwich down, it was so tasteless. The front desk clerks were very friendly and helpful. The shuttle to the airport in the early morning was on time and efficient. I got a good rate here on an internet hotel discount site, and so it was more than adequate for an 8hr overnight stay. Hotel was clean and well appointed, but I would not want to be here for any length of time and have to depend on the hotel for meals.

Reviews.Title: “Very Diappointed ....This is Not 4 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hicynthia13
Reviews.Content: Toronto Airport Marriott Hotel is NOT a 4 Star Hotel! The propertyâ€˜s physically standards, amenities and service levels are at 3 star levels. I was VERY disappointed I wasted over $200 to stay a night at this hotel. I work in the hotel industry, travel extensively, and this was the first time I wrote a letter of complaint. About two weeks after my stay I received a reply from the General Manager providing weak excuses.... including the in-room internet worked....I just didnâ€™t know how to use it. But it appears that other guests are also are having similar problems with internet, as well as ongoing customer service issues, and that is why I am writing this review 8 months after my stay. I arrived at the hotel at approximately 8:30pm with two large suit cases and there was no bellman to help me. A gracious male guest assisted me with one of my cases and I dragged the other case. There was only one Front Desk Clerk on duty, attending to a line of four guests plus me trying to check in. After standing in line for over 30 minutes it was my turn. The female clerk was curt and didnâ€™t bother to apologize or explain why there was no bell available. However, she did offer to store my two large suite cases so I would not have to drag them to my room. I was disappointed with my hotel room it was small and dated, especially the bathroom. It was TERRBILE! It had an old commercial style porcelain tub and tile shower. The old tiles had been sprayed painted white, and were chipped showing the black tiles below. The 2 hand towels and 2 small bath towels were very cheap quality they didnâ€™t even fill the racks, they are something you would expect at a Super 8 Motel. The heat light over the tub had been replaced by an eco light bulb....Iâ€™m all for eco friendly light bulbs in lamps and normal light fixtures.... but a heat light is a nice feature especially with Canadaâ€™s cold winters! After eating dinner in the hotel restaurant I returned to my room to discover the in-room internet was not working. I called and reported the problem to Front Desk; I was told I simply did not know how to use the system. They offered to send a maintenance man to my room. As a single female I did not want a maintenance man in my room after 10pm. So I had declined and checked my email in hotel lobby. The next morning upon checkout $15.95 was charged to my bill for internet...... I had to argue with the Front Desk Clerk to have the charge removed. I understand that times are tough in the hotel industry ....but if you are charging over $200 per night there are certain standards that must be maintained. This Marriott needs to be renovated, the rooms need wireless internet, higher staff levels are required and customer training is a must. Otherwise drop the Marriott Brand name and lower the rate to reflect the hotelâ€™s present 3 star standards!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, dated, deserves a failing grade for no free internet”
Reviews.Author: irlundee
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel, dated but in good condition. One of those 4 stars that gets beaten by any new 3 star (just due to age). Having no free wifi or even wired internet in room is a disgrace for any 3 star hotel, so imagine a 4 star with no free internet? You pay a premium, you get nothing. Parking is amongst the highest of airport hotels in Toronto (no need for them to charge $5 more than other hotels). Not worth the higher prices.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms....Poor service”
Reviews.Author: GregKara
Reviews.Content: It's a nice location, close to lots of restraunts. The pool and hot tub were nice as we had them all to oursleves when we went. nice rooms. clean . I booked on expedia and called a day in advance to ask for a early check in but they had no record of a booking for me. so spent 90 mins on the phone with expedia and the hotel before we finally got resolve. checked in on saturday and even though I asked for two beds they had me booked into a one king for four people !!!! so then we had to wait for them to locate a room with two beds. after checking out I realized I left my medication in the nightstand table . when I called back I was told they found it and they had it. told them I'd be back in the week to get it . Then when I called Thursday to tell them I was coming they assured me they had it. Got to the desk and guess what...no record of my bag !!! they also had no record of me staying there lol. spent 30 mins with three people and no one could find it. Next afternoon I get a call from them....they found my bag and I can come collect it. I informed them that I live 150 kms away and was there yesterday and had all this happen if they could just mail it to me. They said they could....they would just charge my credit card on file for courrier mail costs. When I informed them I shouldn't be the one paying they told me thats how its done . Nice rooms, nice pool, small beds, overpriced parking ( $18 a day ) , and very incompetent staff...almost faulty towers like

Reviews.Title: “Just like the credit card commercial - "Hands In Your Pocket"”
Reviews.Author: CdnOsFan
Reviews.Content: Pros: -Rooms were typical Marriott quality -Easy access from major highways. close to airport Cons: -$18 to park -$15.95 for internet access per day no freebees for Marriott rewards guests, this is 2010 Marriott Toronto Airport!!! -Business center .49/minute for internet, .49/page to print $5 minimum -No bell hop on duty on check-in, waited in line again after checking in to ask for a cart which was locked in a room full of carts by the front desk. -A $65 bid on Priceline turns into almost $120 with taxes, parking and internet which we passed on -There are 2 roughly 15 storey abandoned hotels across the street with many smashed out windows, they looked like a war zone, that was our view. I guess that was the Priceline view even though the hotel seemed quite empty. -Newspapers were left for some of the rooms but not our 2 in the morning -4 star Toronto airports can be had reasonably on Priceline but the extra charges make it not such a good deal!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel w/Expensive Parking”
Reviews.Author: TimP77
Reviews.Content: Went to Toronto for a hockey tournament with my son. Stayed at the Toronto Airport Marriott for one night using my Marriott points. It was only 10,000 pts, which was a great deal for this hotel. Drive up lane was nice and big to get out and check in and unpack the car. Check in was fast and easy. The sold out hotel was jumping on this night because of the hockey tournament in town for the weekend. Which always scares me about sleeping with a hotel full of kids. Went out to dinner at the Keg Steak House down Dixon street about a Â¼ mile. Dinner was very good as always at the Keg. A little pricey but nothing is cheap in Canada. Back to the room, Parked the car, went to our room which turned out to be better than we could have expected. Very clean. Roomy with two nice beds and some nice pillows. Bathroom was clean and roomy with the sink outside of the shower room. And I HAPPY to report that the room was very quiet!!! I only have two complaints with this hotel, the internet cost $14.95 a day. I think thatâ€™s a little over priced. But my biggest complaint would be having to pay $18.95 to park my car for one night, That is over priced to have to park a car. I donâ€™t care if the hotel is around the Toronto airport. It is not at the airport. I only stayed for one night, so paying to park was ok, but if I had to stay for more than one night I think I would have to try to get a deal on the parking. Overall the hotel was very nice and I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Clean Rooms, Crappy Internet”
Reviews.Author: victorylow
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight at the Toronto Airport Marriott Hotel for business. Checked in around 8:30pm with no problems. Ordered room service which I was told should take 45 minutes but ended up coming in 30. I forgot my iPhone charger and asked if there was one at the front desk I could borrow, in case there was a previous customer who left one. Instead, a staff member gave me hers to use for two hours. I thought that was extremely considerate and I was greatly appreciative of her help. I have two gripes: poor internet and lumpy beds. The latter is pretty self explanatory. I could not connect to the internet via wifi or direct connect during the evening. The following morning, I got on but for only five minutes (enough to populate my work emails). It is a real shame the internet does not function because most people in the area are there for work purposes and need to be connected.

Reviews.Title: “no sleep park and fly”
Reviews.Author: skylady
Reviews.Content: we booked this for one night March 28th since we had an early 6:30am flight to the US. We checked in and were told they were full and they gave us a room beside the elevator with one king bed, 2 adults and 2 teenagers. The offered a roll away hard bed that my son slept on and my daughter slept on the chair with her feet over hanging the ottoman. The hotel check in offered our kids ice cream as a compensation!! I called marriott and got $20 off the price big deal. There were so many conventions going on and the noise of the elevator and people in the hall was unbearable. Needless to say I got about 2 hours sleep. Should have stayed home since we live in toronto and took a cab....not a great way to start a holiday..never again

Reviews.Title: “Great location prior to early morning flight”
Reviews.Author: YYZAC
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this property many times before and have reviewed it each time. Since the rennovation of the rooms and common areas, the quality of the hotel has improved. It is a very comfortable property and a great place to stay prior to an early morning flight out of Toronto's Pearson Airport. The room had one queen sized bed and a three seat couch that was placed in an odd looking location directly in front of the window. The couch looked out of place, but was functional. The separate sink area from the toilet and shower is a good idea. Bath and Body Works shower and soap were a nice touch. The room was comfortable, although the standard hotel hall noise: loud guests and the seemingly required constant slamming of room doors was present for most of the stay. However, I did get a good night sleep with my ever present ear plugs. Wake up call came as promised. The wake up call system is fully automated and easier to figure out than the alarm clock. Email and Internet access is not free from the room, but it is available free of charge in the lobby. The airport shuttle comes at regular intervals both from the hotel and the airport. It is not necessary to call or pre-arrange. The shuttle is shared with the Courtyard Marriott, which is next door and the Sheraton which is just down the street. The Marriott is the second stop on both the pick up and drop off. This makes getting to the hotel or airport about a 10 minute trip. Allow for 15 minutes to Terminal 1 as it is the second stop on the trip. There is a restaurant on site as well as a small gift shop which has basically everything that one would need. Free newspapers are available in the lobby. USA Today is delivered to the room each morning. The Keg, a local steakhouse chain is a good food option. It is across the street beside (behind) the Travel Lodge hotel. A short 3 minute walk WEST on Dixon Road. To get downtown, the Malton 58 bus on Dixon Road goes directly to the Lawrence West subway station, although this is a slow 45 minute option. It would be faster to take the hotel shuttle to the airport, then board the Airport Rocket route 192 that goes directly to the Kipling Subway station on the highway. The entire trip takes about 15 minutes and costs the same: $3. Another option is to take the GO bus, same bus stop as the Malton 58, but you have to flag the bus. Is a large coach style bus that is white with a green stripe down the side. The sign on front says "York Mills Terminal" It stops at the Yorkdale subway stop as well as the York Mills Subway stop (different lines). I'm not sure of the cost, but it would be less than $5; however the frequency is every hour. It would pass by the hotel (Dixon Road & Carlingview Drive) at about 15 minutes past each hour. Overall a good stay. Will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “They take pride in training the staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Jetl
Reviews.Content: Rooms are slightly bigger than Sheraton Hotels, renovated, very very clean, comfortable beds! The food is a little expensive but great Sunday brunch! But the best of all this hotel offers is the most outstanding service! All the people that I've dealt with were willing to go the extra mile to accommodate us. That was my WOW factor! Any business should contact the management of this hotel for tips on how to prepare employees for great service. It is very close to the airport which was a positive thing for us. Although we could hear the planes depart, I think the hotel is sound proof; we were able to sleep well at night.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service, noisy rooms and extra fees”
Reviews.Author: an4noone
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a couple of nights after successful bid for $79 per night on priceline.com for a 4 star hotel. It is old crummy hotel with mediocre facilities, poor service and extra fees and charges for every thing. No Wifi in room and cable internet is billed per minute! If you are planning to use internet find another hotel that has free wifi. I was never told at the time of booking or check-in but was surprised to find at checkout that there are $18 per day parking charges. You have to walk through open space from parking to the hotel which is not convinient in cold winter. There was one restaurant there where food was poor and overpriced. The planes fly right over the hotel and the room are not insulated enough so the external noise from planes is conciderable. The TV channel list is fairly small and many channels had no signal. The staff had poor service overall.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel lousy service”
Reviews.Author: Mombo45
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location ,if you want to be close to the airport, with lots of average priced restaurants close by. The rooms and bedding are very nice. We stayed for only one night but would not stay there again. Upon arrival we were told that because we had booked on Priceline that we should expect a "downgraded room" that had 2 queen beds and not a king as booked. They promised a morning paper which was never delivered to our room. The bathroom had only 2 bath towels that were of inferior quality. Never once did any of the hotel employees give us a warm greeting or smile. The iron in our room did not work. One of the bulbs was out in one of the lamps. Parking was $16 a day with in and out priviledges. We were on the second floor and the doors all "slam" when shut so we could hear all our neighbours when they returned to their rooms. Would NEVER stay there again at any price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel as you'd expect”
Reviews.Author: ASyed
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night, large rooms, clean and comfortable. Only difficulty was in checking in, I'd booked two rooms for myself and another family, trouble was I the wrong surname of the other family member so we had trouble convincing the receptionist that the room was for them- even though I'd paid for it on the same credit card! Sense prevailed in the end but I could have done without it- hence the rating. Parking was C$20 for 24 hours

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but expensive.”
Reviews.Author: hatlad
Reviews.Content: First the pros: Very nice facility. Located very near Toronto Int'l. Rooms are very comfortable, quiet and clean. Conference facilities and banquet service was excellent. A very nice place to stay and/or hold a business conference. The few negatives: A VERY pricey place. 1 night stay here was CAN$270+ by the time I figured in all the taxes & internet fees etc onto my CAN$199.00 nightly rate. Parking is not free. Even in our conference facitlity charge our attendees only got a CAN$10.00 parking discount. IF I could make the finances work, I'd stay here again. But if I were on a tighter budget....

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place - but......”
Reviews.Author: BuckyRottweiler
Reviews.Content: Upside - bedding super comfortable, HD TV in the room (had some Boston stations!), good size bathroom, nice shower, excellent fitness room. Staff very friendly and helpful. Downside - Daily parking fee, internet free (wireless) in lobby area, but wired and expensive in room. Restaurant expensive. Had problems with elevators during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but not Marriott's flagship property”
Reviews.Author: edm_IT_traveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight for business. Chose the hotel because of the Marriott bed, and was not disappointed! Great hotel fitness centre, AMAZING restaurant. Has been updated to the new Marriott look and feel, but still has 80's elements, like the tub/toilet/sink. Front desk service was outstanding. Overall, good Marriott property.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: goffsteve
Reviews.Content: Gray on the outside, beautiful on the inside. As far as airport hotels go, this one is near the top for me. Renovations have done wonders -- excellent restaurant, pleasant lobby, very nice rooms. Shuttle to the terminals every 25 minutes, though it does stop at other properties. About a half-hour taxi ($45 Canadian) to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “The Marriott can do much better.”
Reviews.Author: reclermo
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Marriott Toronto Airport a couple times in the last two months and have not been impressed with the property and the management. The biggest problem stemmed from the fact that they were not able to handle multiple individual bookings and combine them into one reservation. I had made sure to advise of this situation on check in; however, while I was away on a business trip my wife was made to vacate our room by a misinformed housekeeper. The situation could have been easily been resolved with a call to the front desk and a suitable response by the manager. They treated my wife like a squatter and did not believe her when she said she was my wife as my name was filed under the reservation and I was unavailable to answer my phone. For all this, they took off my parking charge for the visit, which was a nice gesture but left me far from being satisfied for the damage their blunder had caused. I stay at Marriott properties quite often, and this one does not fall into the same quality level from the service to the rooms. It should be classed as a 3 star property as there are much better options in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Felt more like a Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: akschalke04
Reviews.Content: The biggest complaint I have with this hotel is the lack of adequate air conditioning in my room. Someone else mentioned this on here before. My first room wouldn't cool down at all and when I switched to the second room, it didn't get much better. Now, the interesting thing is that my colleague's room cooled down just fine. I had maintenance check into it and they told me that it needed time to cool down. I've had the AC on the lowest setting for half a day. So there is clearly an issue with that. Staff is very friendly. Best part of the hotel. Room service is OK but takes a while. They close room service at midnight (or earlier if it is quiet) and I thought that was strange for a "full service" hotel at a major international airport. Shuttle doesn't go often enough and you may end up waiting for half an hour or more. The elevators are old and filthy. The workout facility is OK with good equipment but no water to be found. Ultimately, the entire hotel felt more like a Marriott Courtyard to me than a full service Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Great value; Great Service”
Reviews.Author: WDB999
Reviews.Content: I stayed just one night at the Toronto Airport Marriott recently, after avoiding it for several years. I visit Toronto monthly, and most recently have stayed at the Renaissance or one of the Courtyards in the area. The Airport Marriott recently underwent renovations, making it very appealing now. All aspects of the rental were positive except one: The towels definitely need to be upgraded. They are course, not fluffy, and a source of irritation. Hard to downgrade a hotel for just one item, but this definitely needs attention.

Reviews.Title: “Closeness to Toronto Downtown”
Reviews.Author: ondwargaurav
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its location. The hotel is located with best nerby subway station i.e Bloor & Younge. The hotel also gives ample chance to roam arround the Bloor Street and younge Street, which was very good. Service need to notch up, especially food.

Reviews.Title: “Functional, effective and it worked”
Reviews.Author: mrs_claire_ann
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in October 2008, while on business in Toronto. I found the hotel really well set up for jet-lagged travellers who wanted to eat their meals at 3am in the morning, the 24 hour room service was great. Usually there are a lot of niggly things on business trips, but none here... The curtains closed properly and were made of the toughest blackout material so there was not light seeping into the room. Internet was easy to install and worked. Lot's of taxis available so easy to get out without a major logistics challenge. Nice staff and great rooms... Location can only be described as edge of the airport, but there was no noise and it suited me for my travels around

Reviews.Title: “50/50”
Reviews.Author: xbarbiie
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for NYE 09. The room we got was spacious, the bed is literally amazing,best sleep ever. The temperature was easily controlled. No mini-fridge. You can hear through the walls of your neighbours. The hot-tub is not hot nor is the pool. People were smoking chronic in the rooms and its a no smoking policy. The check in was lenghthy. Bath-robes as per request, once requested took 5 mins to brings them up. Very clean room. Washroom OK. Will not return again, its 4 stars but seems like a 3.5

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: Colonnia
Reviews.Content: The Marriott at the Toronto airport has turned out to be a convenient stay. Here comes the verdict. PRO'S: - close to the airport - no suprise if you are familiar with Mariotts - great gym - great breakfast although expensive - great service CON's: - very expensive parking ($16 per day) - I have seen the rooms advertised above $ 260 - they are definetely not worth such an amount - Nickel & diming: internet charges in excess of $ 10 per day. - If you are noise sensitive, you may find the starting airplanes annoying. It did not disturb me since the insulation is quite good. When they land (depends on the wind), you won't really hear them.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and cllean”
Reviews.Author: Wellingtonian
Reviews.Content: I got a good rate on priceline and I was satisfied with my stay. The shuttle took half an hour to show up at the airport. The reception staff were correct but not friendly. The room was spotless, spacious, and comfortable. Everything in the bathroom worked properly, plenty of amenities. Room service was prompt and friendly, and the food was tasty. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “'Free' airport parking.”
Reviews.Author: UnicornUDIC
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel and the deal that includes 8 nights free underground parking paired with free aiport shuttle is worth its weight in gold. They are still working on some renovations but this time we were on the newly updated 9th floor which was very nice indeed. Room service is excellent though somewhat limited time wise until they complete the upgrades. Couple of tiny, tiny gripes: 1. would be nice to have a newspaper delivered free. 2. only one half full box of tissues is provided and that was finally located perched on the top of the loo - I was expecting it to be in the washbasin area of the room, would have been more convenient.

Reviews.Title: “no problem at all”
Reviews.Author: blondie091
Reviews.Content: I stayed over for 1 night, Saturday July 19th to catch a flight to Cuba the following day. I had obtained a good rate of $119 a month or more previous to arriving online. No changes were permitted for this rate. I caught the complimentary shuttle service with no problem from YYZ airport upon arrival from Halifax early afternoon. I might have waited about 5 to 10 minutes is all. Check in was fast, efficient and friendly. My room was very nice on the third floor, view of the entrance overlay. The roar of planes from the nearby runways was very minimal unlike what I had read about in previous reviews of this hotel. Internet connection in room and the lobby was fast and clear. I had dinner with friends at the West by East Bistro within the hotel and found it very overpriced with a limited menu, so so service. Had it not been for a downpour and lightening weather conditions we would have eaten elsewhere and wish now that we had moved on. Next day check out was a breeze and the shuttle came right on schedule, friendly driver who handled the luggage carefully. I would definately stay again and probably will in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms Small - Sort of Pet Friendly - Room decor tired. Room Service OK.”
Reviews.Author: pwrshift
Reviews.Content: I had booked a 'cars eat too' room package for $149 per night (included self parking fee and $25 Petro Canada gas card). The room was supposed to be a king deluxe room with a sofabed -what we got was a normal king with just one chair/ottoman - much smaller than ordered. Called front desk and they gave me another room as ordered but made it very clear they were not happy with my complaining and kept me hanging on the phone for 20 minutes before 'finding' the right room as booked. They even suggested they'd put in a roll-away cot if I wanted an extra bed but I don't know where they'd put it as there was simply no room. The hotel was very busy for a Saturday and they only had two people on check in, so we had to wait twice ... once for checking in to the wrong room and again for finding the right room. The right room was larger, but not by much. The self parking is a zoo -- 4 floor of it but only 2 floors with elevator service so be prepared to carry your bags up/down stairs as a lot of the cars are there for 8 nights due to one of their other 'deals' where you get 8 nights parking if you stay there one night...great if you are flying away for a week from the nearby Pearson airport. Not so great if you self park. Room decor: Old Marriott. Except for the (quite hard) Revive bed the rest of the room was tired - even a little 25 inch CRT TV. No Mini-Bar or fridge. Carpet real old (green). A/C blew all night no matter how high we made the temp. Room cleanliness left a lot to be desired - there were corks and papers under the bed and sofabed that the maid never even looked for. Glasses were dirty (lipstick) so we had to clean ourselves before using. Coffee machine did not work...but we got free coffee from the lobby. Pet Friendly: Not as friendly as Westin offers with heavenly doggie beds, ID tags, candies, bowls, etc. They have a $30 doggie fee though. Room service was good but far from hot when delivered: Dinner for 2 (plus grilled chicken breast for dog) was $150 including a $39 bottle of wine: Hamburger (good) with fries ($15); Fillet 8 oz was $35 with baked potato; Onion soup $8; cake $7. 18% service charge. Breakfast (2 omlets) was $35. Movie was $15. Room noise: I think the hotel was full this night and there must have been a lot of kids as they were running up halls until quite late. We could also hear planes at the airport. Next time we'll try the nearby Renaissance instead, but decided to stay at the Marriott because the 'pet' fee was $30 while it was $60 at the Ren. Apparently the Ren is newer and you won't hear the plane noise as much. We had to ask for the $25 gas card included in the room rate when checking out and almost left without it after checking out. None of the front desk clerks knew anything about it and had to call the manager to get the card for me.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: 45DegreesNorth
Reviews.Content: I stay at the property every six months to attend a trade show on the Airport strip. Every January and August the gift show takes place and many of the airport strip hotels are full of exhibitors and attendees. The Congress Centre and the International Centre are very close. So if you are wondering who stays in this hotel besides those not wishing to have a long drive before they catch that early flight to the Carribean in the morning, you will find a lot of business travellers. Having said that, the Marriott is a very comeptent hotel. They have just gone through a renovation - for those of you who have visited this hotel in the past, the Mikado restaurant is gone, the bar/club is gone. There is now a bar next to the restaurant which style-wise I think is nicer - that old billiard bar always seemed out of place. However, they need to adjust the lighting for the outer part of that bar, it is way too bright for a bar. The part closer to the restaurant is more pleasant. The service in the restaurant is very warm and helpful - their staff seems to stay there for years and years, there seems to be a big loyalty factor. They remember my name even though I have not been there for six months (and I have not left on my name tag from the show!) The food is very good, and the restaurant has a nice ambience with a view to the back lawn and wooded area which is pleasant (seeing that it is an airport hotel). They have a vegetarian ravioli dish which I could not get enough of, I could have had it every time I ate there. The rooms are nice and the bedding is fantastic - nice puffy duvets and pillows. I love it. Cannot say anything bad about the rooms. And I didn't hear noise even though it is close to the airport. The hotel is located very close to the airport, but don't take a taxi, it costs almost $20 which is ridiculous. Take the shuttle. It depends on which terminal you are in for which post wait next to, but ask someone as you follow the signs for shuttle buses, OR call the hotel and they will tell you. I have never had to wait that long and I go there often. It is a pleasant ride and they stop at the Marriott first, it is not a milk run like some of the other shuttles. They have a business centre which is handy, you can go on the internet, etc. and print (for a price). What kills me when I stay here in the summer is the lack of an outdoor pool. If you stay at the Holiday Inn Select across the road they have a fabulous outdoor pool (and indoor as well). The Marriott only has an indoor pool. And if you sit outside in the back, try getting served a drink. In this area the Select has it all over the Marriott. However we don't want to switch back and forth between the Marriott and the Select, it gets confusing for our group, so we stick with the Marriott. Also the Marriott has a good points program, make sure you sign up. One final note: they can handle themselves in a crisis - a number of years ago there was a blackout in Toronto. It affected a large area of the city, hotels included. The Marriott handled itself wonderfully, passing out little 'glow in the dark' sticks to find our rooms, it opened the buffett to everyone, and it was all handled very well I thought. All in all, a good solid business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KimGroomes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the night before we flew out for our family vacation. We got a smashing price by booking through our travel agent. I loved the underground parking,( parking was free for the 14 days we were away), and the rooms were lovely. Very helpful staff, rooms were very tastefully decorated, and the shuttle was very big. If I had to pay the regular full price for the room night, I probably would have stayed somewhere else. Great location, close to Pearson Airport. For the same great price, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great comfortable room, AWESOME Bed!”
Reviews.Author: ottomowbeels
Reviews.Content: I was at this hotel for a conference and found the parking a challenge but the facility very nice. The bed was amazing to where I actually pulled the sheets back to find out why it was so comfortable. It had an amazing feather matress pad and awesome sheets and comforter. One of the best sleeps in a long time! Room service was quick and tasty too! I would definitely go back if I need a spot close to the airport, and didn't hear the planes.

Reviews.Title: “We won't be back”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryDoyler
Reviews.Content: Oh where to begin...............The shuttle bus from the airport did not show up for 35 minutes. Check in was fine. The room was spacious and modern, the bed was comfortable. We arrived at our room at about 8:30pm and wanted to check our email(keep in touch with the kids) before we went for dinner in the restaurant downstairs. Couldn't get the internet to work, phoned down to the front desk. They would send someone up immediately .Went downhill from there, the guy didn't show up for 85 minutes. Very frustrating, only option for internet access in the room is $16/day. When we went for dinner we discovered free wireless was available in the restaurant and lounge. Had a snack in the lounge instead of dinner, it was very good. Room temperature could not be controlled properly, way too hot all night, did not sleep well. We did not trust the shuttle service so we took a taxi to the airport in the morning. Bottom lineâ€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦..not good

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Service”
Reviews.Author: CADTravel
Reviews.Content: Night of our wedding. Advised we would be checking in very late at 2AM. In any event when we arrived somehow our reservation was cancelled, but they noted that it was cancelled earlier in the day?? As it was 2AM they put us into a suite on the top floor with a boardroom table etc. Also, they treated us to complimentary breakfast the next morning as room service. As it was too late to order room service for breakfast the next morning, they took our order over phone in the morning and promptly had it delivered. Shuttle to the airport the following afternoon was very convenient. In addition our rate was quoted at $125, and when we checked out they only charged us $80!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: KPTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel prior to a trip south. Price was very reasonable in comparison to other airport hotels, and included up to 2 weeks of free parking while we were away. The parking is mostly underground with elevator access which made it easy to come and go. The lobby is very nice, with friendly helpful staff. Room check in was a breeze. We stayed in a standard room, which was clean and comfortable. The king bed was very nice. The bathroom was clean, although a little bit dated. Separate room for toilet/shower. Shuttle service to/from airport leaves every 15 minutes and was fast and efficient. The driver was helpful with our several large suitcases. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling out of Toronto airport. The only real downside is the hotel is a little dated, but this is really only a minor cosmetic thing.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott-Airport”
Reviews.Author: Daveptaz
Reviews.Content: The location was great as we had a late flight in. So, quick to get to from the airport. They are in the middle of renovations, so they were lacking in some of their "normal" amenities (the bar is makeshift in a meeting room). I got a deal thru Hotwire, so didn't really mind.

Reviews.Title: “Bonus Bucked”
Reviews.Author: manelias
Reviews.Content: We were stranded in Toronto because of flight delays. We called this hotel and asked them if it was alright to use a $100US Bonus Buck coupon for a one night stay even though the coupon said that you had to stay for 2 nights. Their front desk manager said no problem come on down and use the $100 on check-out. The next morning when we presented the coupon upon check-out we were informed that it could not be used. We asked to speak to the hotel manager and was told that they had too many managers but none was available to talk to us. We were given a business card of a front desk manager and told that we would be contacted for a resolution. We are still waiting for a reply.....

Reviews.Title: “Thorough Review on a Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BlvlTraveller
Reviews.Content: Located virtually beside Toronto International Airport, the Marriott Toronto Airport is extremely convenient for those using the airport and is served by a daily shuttle that runs every 15 minutes and is free. Unfortunately, if you are without your own wheels there are only 2 restaurants and a coffee shop within walking distance, although the hotel does have a couple (overpriced as usual) restaurants of it's own. The hotel is middle aged, but nice looking with well kept grounds and ample parking which will cost you an extra 12$ per night. It is easy to find and sits right on the main drag by the airport with a wide lane for dropoff. You can park right in front while checking in and getting your room setup. Lobby and Check-in: The lobby area is expansive with luxurious sitting areas, a bar, restaurants and class typical of Marriott and other 3-4 star hotels. Check-in was speedy and staff are friendly and efficient. I also got this hotel for 36$ through Priceline (3 separate times) and service was not diminished by this. Rooms: Rooms are clean and quiet but otherwise unremarkable. The room comes complete with TV, phone/internet hookup (12.95 for highspeed but I didn't use so can't report on this) desk and chair, coffee maker, minibar, lounge chair and closet. Like I said, your typical 3-4 star but nothing extra special. The TV was sufficiently large and modern and offered a large selection of cable (40 channels) and movies on demand. The chairs and desk were comfortable and acceptable for minimal use, but I wouldn't want to attempt an all-nighter as it is a tad small and the chair wasn't quite high enough. The bed was OK - I'd give it a 7/10 rating on comfort and the comforter was nice and thick although I would have liked the pillows to be a bit thicker. I would also say the hotel has done an excellent job of soundproofing and while hall noise is at times notable, there is no sound from outside the hotel. Amenities & Restaurants: Disclosure: I used the pool with my kids but did not frequent the restaurants. The pool is excellent. It is quite large and sits in the middle of an atrium where you can watch planes overhead as you swim. It was very clean and warm without feeling soupy. The hot tub was also... hot and clean, and there are a number of tables and chairs so you can sit and read/work while the kids swim. The fitness centre is small but adequate for maintaining fitness with 4-5 bikes and treadmills from which you can watch a small TV with Sports running. The free weight selections were quite good although the universal system was a bit dated. There are 3 restaurants and a bar. The bar prices are expensive although coffee in the morning is OK and they serve Starbucks brew (no espresso type drinks though). There is a high priced sushi restaurant, and North American upper class dining restaurant and a pub. The Pub would be your best bet for cheaper food of the 3, but I can't speak to quality as I did not eat at any of the 3. Check-out: Check-out was quick and uneventful, and can be expedited by completing checkout on your TV prior. Service: Service was friendly and accommodating, although I had little interaction aside from a phone call to book and check-in/check-out.

Reviews.Title: “Too Expensive for What you Get”
Reviews.Author: JusticeSalmon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really expensive for a standard, business as usual Marriott. Despite the fact that everyone was really friendly, the room was over priced and the food and drinks were extremely overpriced. If you need a place to stay near the airport, this is a fine, clean hotel, but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “"hidden costs"”
Reviews.Author: NutMegSLG
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and beds were comfortable. TV guide was a convenient touch. Parking at $15.00 per day was a surprise. Internet access was $9.99 per day. Local phone calls were $1.10 per call. We decided to eat elsewhere since the prices in the restaurants were so very high. We will not be using this overpriced hotel again when we go to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “ok, expensive”
Reviews.Author: eers
