Reviews.Content: defenitly a good hotel.. Parking costs you $13 / day Rooms are good but not as great as the Crowney Plaza Don valley where we stayed the next few days... Frequent Airport shuttles available.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Mr.Babies
Reviews.Content: Had 2 rooms, the rooms had been redone since a previous visit. They were excellent very nice bedding and decor. Now we try and only use Marriott hotels, Fairfield,Courtyard or Residence. You can beat them and we get friends and family rates so that helps too. I totally recommend them good quality.

Reviews.Title: “An odd first impression, but wasn't that bad”
Reviews.Author: FLSMARK
Reviews.Content: The first impression was a young lady at the check in counter who refused to check in my room b/c my reservation was under the name of a coworker who was on the golf course. When I got him on the phone to verify, she said that she did not care and I was going to have to make a seperate reservation at the rack rate. Upon bringing her manager out, she was placed on Valet Parking duty... pretty entertaining. I usually cannot stand the cheapness of Marriott beds, however the bed and the room were more at the SPG level. The service (for Canada) was excellent and staff pleasant. It was the most customer service friendly experience in Canada to date.

Reviews.Title: “Average Room, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Toronto Airport Marriott for one night. We checked their prices online and then called their 1-800 number and got the same price, but were able to lock in some extra features (king-size bed, etc). The hotel is a good deal for travellers - we got up to 14 nights parking for free, free shuttle to/from the airport departing every 15 minutes, and the room was $109 CAD for the night. The room was average: clean, comfortable but nothing special. At checkin, however, we mentioned that we were flying out the next morning for our honeymoon. That night, we received a knock on our door - it was our check in clerk with a card signed by the front desk staff congratulating us, along with Laura Secord chocolates and nuts. So if the price stays competitive we'll stay there again. Other pluses: near lots of restaurants, very easy to get to, not a lot of noise from airplanes.

Reviews.Title: “Nickled and Dimed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel iteself is about average, and the rate is average, but you end up paying more because nothing is included in the rate. Parking, internet access, phone calls, breakfast, etc. all add up to a high price for an average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a music convention and received a great discount from this beautiful hotel. From the time you arrive at the front door the staff are there to assist you with anything you need. They load up your luggage and take you right up to your room and get you settled in. Every staff member I met was very polite and greeted me warmly and was quite willing to give me directions for shopping and attractions. They went out of their way to make sure all our needs were met. The room was beautiful and the hotel had 2 fairly fancy restaurants and a lounge where you could have a few drinks and order a burger or other light meals. They had a coffee shop which overlooked the lovely pool and fitness area and the elevator took you right to the underground parking garage. If you want to stay where you're treated like royalty for a reasonable rate then I would highly reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great Marriott experience”
Reviews.Author: bperl1
Reviews.Content: Despite staying only one night, and on a deep discounted rate, I received top-rate service from check-in to check-out from the Marriott Toronto Airport staff. Check-in was accomplished quickly and the CSA was able to get me a non-smoking room. The room itself was typical of a Marriott. Smallish, but clean and elegantly decorated. The bed was relatively new and in good condition; however it was a bit firm for my taste. Check-out was just as quick and painless using the On-demand system in room. Upon departure the front-desk staff was able to give me excellent directions to a nearby subway station. If my travels ever take me to Toronto again I will happily stay at the Marriott again.
